name: enjoin
content:

formal to tell someone to do something or to behave in a particular way: [ + to infinitive ] We were all enjoined to be on our best behaviour. He enjoined (= suggested) caution.
law
  US specialized to legally force someone to do something or stop doing something

to legally forbid or stop something by order of a court: The prosecutor’s office hopes the court will enjoin the city from enforcing the law.
Enjoin also means to order or strongly encourage someone to do something: Lawyers are enjoined to follow high ethical principles.
